articles.title: Hatton Garden heist mastermind Brian Reader is dead aged 84: Gangster who made more than £200million from string of raids including Brink's-Mat robbery dies after cancer battle

articles.content:

articles.title: UK to boost defence spending to 2.5% of GDP, Sunak says
articles.description: PM announces plan to increase spending to £87bn a year by 2030 on visit to Poland
articles.content:
Britain will boost its defence spending to 2.5% of national output by the end of the decade, Rishi Sunak has announced on a visit to Poland, as he warned the UK had to be equipped to meet the challenges of an increasingly dangerous world.

articles.title: Britain will boost defence spending to 2.5pc, Sunak to announce
articles.description: Prime Minister has been under pressure to increase funds for MoD
articles.content:
Rishi Sunak is set to announce that Britain will spend 2.5 per cent of GDP on defence by 2030.
It means the UK is expected to commit £70 billion extra on core defence funding over seven years than it does now, the equivalent of more than £9 billion a... [694 chars]

articles.title: Erik ten Hag labels reaction to Manchester United's Coventry win 'embarrassing' and a 'disgrace'
articles.description: Manchester United manager has hit back at media criticism saying reaching successive FA Cup finals is a ‘huge achievement’
articles.content:
Erik ten Hag has branded the reaction to Manchester United’s FA Cup semi-final victory against Coventry a “disgrace” and claimed the only “embarrassment” is the criticism directed at his team.

articles.title: Meta Horizon OS could become the Windows of headsets
articles.description: Meta Horizon OS will be available for manufacturers like Asus, Lenovo, and Microsoft to use for future Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR) headsets, Meta (formerly known as Facebook) has confirmed. The operating system enables hand and eye-tracking and offers access to a huge app library, including Gmail, Microsoft Word, and Canva
articles.content: Meta, formerly known as Facebook, will license its software to companies like Asus, Lenovo and Microsoft's Xbox to power dozens of new Virtual Reality (VR) and Augmented Reality (AR) headsets. The shake-up mirrors Google's decision to offer its Andro... [5081 chars]
